page.title: 09MAIDSTONE:HOUSING OLD PEOPLE
page.content: The percentage of Maidstone's citizens who are elderly has recently increased and so has the demand for specialised housing. Large detached houses have been converted into old people's homes such as Loose Court (763531), Stone Lodge (766537), and Karewell (767542). There has also been a demand for small self-contained and easily managed houses suited to the elderly. A recent example of an estate of such houses is at Hillden Shaw(763538), where a full- time warden provides for the security of the old people and organises their community centre. Nearer the town centre small blocks of self-contained flats have been built along Waterloo Street (765551). Similar flats may be seen in the Spinney (769548) along West Park Road, where there is also a small terrace of dormer bungalows for the elderly.
